bill_title: to provide increased authority to the Board of Economic Development to encourage loans in municipalities with a population of less than two thousand.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide increased authority to the Board of Economic Development to encourage loans in municipalities with a population of less than two thousand. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 1-16G be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Board of Economic Development may award a loan from the revolving economic development and initiative fund to any eligible applicant locating or expanding in a municipality with a population of two thousand or less for a loan amount up to fifteen thousands dollars for each full time equivalent position and the board may also authorize loan participation up to seventy-five percent of the total projects cost. The board may award a loan amount up to twenty-five thousand dollars for each full time equivalent position if the project has significant economic development or job creation impact for the municipality. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
